productPurposeAnalysis.productPurpose: Shadow Watch aims to transform software development teams' productivity by acting as an intelligent assistant that continuously understands, documents, and improves codebases. Its core mission is to eliminate the manual cognitive burden of understanding complex code, writing documentation, planning tests, and identifying quality issues by leveraging AI to automate these time-consuming activities while keeping developers in their primary workflow environment (VS Code).
productPurposeAnalysis.architectureRationale: The architecture exists as a VS Code extension with a single entry point because the product's fundamental value proposition is seamless integration into developers' existing workflow without context switching. Unlike standalone tools or web services that require developers to leave their editor, Shadow Watch embeds all capabilities directly into VS Code where developers already spend their time. The single entry point (extension.js) reflects this focused integration strategy - the product doesn't need multiple entry points because it serves one primary user type (developers in VS Code) through one cohesive interface (the VS Code extension API). The architecture is organized around modular capabilities (analysis, AI integration, UI, persistence) because the product must handle diverse workflows (documentation generation, test planning, refactoring guidance) while maintaining fast performance through caching and incremental updates. The AI integration layer with multiple provider support (OpenAI, Claude) exists because the product's intelligence depends entirely on LLM capabilities, requiring flexible provider options for reliability, cost management, and access to different AI models' strengths.
designDecisions: Modular architecture with separate analysis, AI, UI, and persistence layers - Reason: Enables independent evolution of each capability while supporting diverse user workflows from code analysis to test generation without creating a monolithic codebase

Tree view providers for presenting results in VS Code sidebar - Reason: Provides familiar, native VS Code navigation patterns that developers already understand, enabling quick browsing of analysis results without learning new interfaces

Inline diagnostics provider surfacing issues directly in editor - Reason: Meets users where they work by showing problems at their exact location rather than requiring navigation to separate reports, reducing friction in addressing issues

24-hour caching layer for analysis results and AI insights - Reason: Eliminates redundant expensive AI API calls and re-analysis of unchanged code, ensuring fast subsequent loads critical for maintaining developer flow

File watcher with automatic re-analysis on save - Reason: Keeps insights current without manual triggering, transforming Shadow Watch from a one-time analysis tool into a continuous monitoring assistant

Iterative AI analysis supporting multi-round conversations - Reason: Enables comprehensive codebase understanding by allowing the AI to request additional context across multiple interactions, mimicking how humans explore unfamiliar code

Support for multiple AI providers (OpenAI and Claude) - Reason: Prevents vendor lock-in, provides fallback options when one service is unavailable, and allows users to choose models best suited for their needs and budgets

Rate limiting and retry logic in AI integration layer - Reason: Ensures reliable operation despite API limitations and network issues, critical for a tool that developers depend on during active coding sessions

Export capabilities for HTML reports and AI assistant formats - Reason: Extends value beyond VS Code by enabling sharing with teams and integration with other AI-powered development tools like Cursor and ChatGPT

Navigation handlers linking tree views directly to code locations - Reason: Reduces time to action by eliminating manual searching, enabling developers to jump immediately from insight to relevant code for remediation
